intro: Illigera cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf illigera, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
